title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Italy is efficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Italy is efficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Italy has the comparative advantage in the production of perfume and/or does not explain that Italy has the lower opportunity cost in producing perfume: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of perfume in Italy is 0.04 unit of shoes and in France it is 0.1 unit of shoes.

The response states that Italy has the comparative advantage in the production of perfume and explains that Italy has the lower opportunity cost in producing perfume: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of perfume in Italy is 0.04 unit of shoes and in France it is 0.1 unit of shoes.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, France will not gain from trade and/or does not explain that these terms of trade are less than France’s opportunity cost of producing shoes.
The response states that no, France will not gain from trade and explains that these terms of trade are less than France’s opportunity cost of producing shoes.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that France has the absolute advantage in the production of shoes and/does not explain that after the production of shoes triples, France can produce a maximum of 15 shoes and Italy can produce a maximum of 6 shoes with the same amount of resources.

The response states that France has the absolute advantage in the production of shoes and explains that after the production of shoes triples, France can produce a maximum of 15 shoes and Italy can produce a maximum of 6 shoes with the same amount of resources.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of unemployed people in France as 6 million and/or does not show the work.

Unemployed=Labor Force×Unemployment Rate=60 million×50%×20%=6 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7E18@

The response calculates the number of unemployed people in France as 6 million and shows the work.

Unemployed=Labor Force×Unemployment Rate=60 million×50%×20%=6 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7E18@
